name: Zoo Compressed File
summary: Learn about .ZOO files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: In the 1980s, developer Rahul Dhesi created the zoo compression program and the ZOO file format. Zoo was available for Unix-based operating systems, MS-DOS, and AmigaOS.

Notably, ZOO archives can contain multiple versions of the same file, if each version was modified on a different date. This allows zoo users to save and retrieve prior versions of a file from a ZOO archive, to revert to a previous version or compare an old version to a more recent version.

instructions:
Programs that open ZOO files include

zoo (Free) for (Windows, Linux)
You can open a ZOO file with Logipole Konvertor (Windows), ESTsoft ALZip (Windows), The Unarchiver (Mac), or zoo (Windows, Linux).
